ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I wrote a 60 page thesis! Working closely with my advisor while setting my own schedule was a successful, rewarding experience.
This semester I used this course to work on my thesis!
Really recommend doing a senior thesis if there is a topic you're genuinely interested in!

Second half of thesis. This is part where you will actually write and edit. This was the most challenging class, assignment, intellectual engagement I've had at Yale. Don't forget that you have a large group of people there to help you  your advisor, the essay coordinator, other ER&M faculty, your dean, college writing tutors.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class does not meet, so nothing to add for thismy relationship with my advisor was great!
I thought there was a good amount of facilitation and guidance.

I really like the AMST model of writing groups and wish ER&M had more of that. 

Strengths -- time to do the work and support to complete the project you're most excited about.

There should be some more check-ins throughout the semester and more accountability for advisors. I've heard from several people that they've had advisors become unresponsive. There should be more guidance about what to do in this situation on the front-end during the fall semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I would strongly recommend the full-year thesis to any ER&M studentit's a good way to push yourself and grow as a student your senior year.
Yes! Writing a year-long thesis in a very specific focus was one of the most awarding things I did at Yale and more people should have that experience.
Really recommend doing a senior thesis if there is a topic you're genuinely interested in!

extras.title: ER&M 492 01 - The Senior Essay or Project
